title: 105_hr2958
content: The Act titled "Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act Amendments of 1997" changes the name of the Delaware and Lehigh Navigation Canal National Heritage Corridor to "Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor." The purpose is to enhance economic development within the preservation context, and the Corridor Commission is established. The Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988 is amended to include 3 individuals: the Director of the Pennsylvania Department of Conservation and Natural Resources, the Director of the Pennsylvania Department of Community and Economic Development, and the Chairperson of the Pennsylvania Historical and Museum Commission. The Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988 is amended to include 3 individuals: the Director of the Pennsylvania Department of Conservation and Natural Resources, the Director of the Pennsylvania Department of Community and Economic Development, and the Chairperson of the Pennsylvania Historical and Museum Commission. The Governor will nominate individuals to represent specific areas and counties in Pennsylvania, increasing the total number of individuals from 8 to 9. The Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988 is amended to include 3 individuals representing the northern, middle, and southern regions of the Corridor. The terms for Commission members appointed under subsection (b) include a 3-year term, serving until a successor is appointed, and replacement procedures in case of resignation or incapacity. The Secretary appoints a new member within 60 days of receiving a nomination from the Governor to serve for the remainder of the term. A member can serve for a maximum of 2 full terms. Confirmation of appointments must be accepted or rejected within 60 days of receiving a nomination from the Governor. The Commission has powers outlined in Section 5. The Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988 is amended to allow conveyance of real estate to nonprofit organizations, expand cooperative agreements with non-profit organizations, and modify grants and loans provisions. The Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988 is amended to allow the Commission to administer grants and loans from appropriated or donated funds. SEC. 6. The Commission's duties are expanded to include interpreting the historic, cultural, natural, recreational, and scenic aspects of the Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988. SEC. 7. The Commission's termination date is extended to 10 years after the enactment of the Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act Amendments of 1997. SEC. 8. Other federal entities have specific duties outlined in the Act. SEC. 8. Duties of other federal entities are amended to include the historic, cultural, natural, recreational, or scenic aspects. SEC. 9. Authorization of appropriations. SEC. 9. Authorization of appropriations amended to increase funding for the Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988. $1,000,000 authorized for each fiscal year 1998 through 2007 for the management action plan. The Delaware and Lehigh National Heritage Corridor Act of 1988 is amended to include a new section regarding local authority and private property rights. The Commission is prohibited from interfering with private property rights or local zoning ordinances in Pennsylvania.
